translation.ko: 자동차 업계 중역들 중 드로리안이 최초로

translation.en: who saw the power of that and took advantage of it.
translation.ko: 문화의 힘을 제대로 파악하고 이용한 겁니다

translation.en: [John] We set new sales records and profit records,
translation.ko: 우리 회사는 판매와 수익 부문에서 신기록을 세웠는데

translation.en: which I don't think have ever been equaled.
As a result of that, I was made a group executive
translation.ko: 덕분에 GM의 생산 총괄 부사장으로 승진해서

translation.en: in charge of all of GM's North American car and truck operations,
translation.ko: 북미의 GM 승용차와 트럭 생산 전체를 관리하게 됐어요

translation.en: which is about 92% of General Motors' total profitability.
translation.ko: 그게 제너럴 모터스 총 수익의 약 92%를 차지했죠

translation.en: [man] He was a free-thinker.
He didn't like stifling conformity of General Motors,
translation.ko: 제너럴 모터스의 갑갑한 사내 문화를 싫어했어요

translation.en: which was all the more astounding because he kept rising in the ranks
translation.ko: 더더욱 놀라운 일이었죠 순전히 기술과 판촉 능력만으로 승진을 거듭한 거니까요

translation.en: from sheer skill and merchandising ability.
translation.ko: 순전히 기술과 판촉 능력만으로 승진을 거듭한 거니까요

translation.ko: 차든 돈이든 마구 뿌릴 만큼 많았으니까요

I have a reasonably strong sex drive,

No man who ever accomplished something

translation.en: didn't have that one characteristic.

translation.ko: 처음 만났을 때 존은 아주 품위 있었어요

translation.en: and he just looked so glamorous and virile.
[clears throat] On top of the world.
And he played off of that,
but underneath, the exact opposite was happening.
translation.ko: 스스로 그런 이미지를 만들었지만 수면 아래에서는 정반대였죠

translation.en: I was writing a book called Passages

translation.ko: 중년의 위기를 겪는 사람들을 찾고 있었어요

translation.en: That was one of the bases of the book.
And John DeLorean had a massive midlife crisis.
translation.ko: 존 드로리안은 심각한 중년의 위기를 겪고 있었어요

translation.en: [Gail] And I was able to get an interview with him.
How long does it take to get one of these put together? What are they?
translation.ko: 만드는 데 얼마나 걸리죠? 저건 뭔가요?

translation.en: [Gail] He was an engineer and he loved building things.
translation.ko: 존은 엔지니어였고 뭘 만드는 걸 좋아했어요

translation.en: But then he went on up to the 14th floor, or the executive suite,
where he was in the corporate offices,
where he had a higher position,
more money, but he wasn't a starboy anymore.
And that was very tough for him.
And then it became more than that.
It became also,
"Hey," you know, "I could die."
He recognized his own mortality,
and it's what I call midlife crisis,
and I was just beginning to develop that thesis,
uh, that this is a common thing in, from--
at that time between 35 and 45 for men.
And it happened for John DeLorean like a landslide.
[John] I think it sort of came to me one time
when I was making the new car announcement.
And we're telling the dealers and the public
what a dramatic and miraculous new car this was, and it really wasn't.
translation.ko: 이 신차가 얼마나 극적이고 놀라운지 설명하는데 사실은 그냥 똑같은 차였어요

translation.en: It was the same old car
with the fenders bent a little bit differently.
translation.ko: 펜더가 살짝 다른 모양으로 휘었을 뿐이죠

translation.en: And so I thought,
"I just can't keep doing this."
[Gail] He fell into a second adolescence, really.
So the first thing was you had to discard the old version,
translation.ko: 일단 본인의 예전 모습은 모두 폐기했어요

and then you had to go to the gym all the time and bulk up.
translation.ko: 그러고는 맨날 체육관에 가서 몸을 키웠어요

translation.en: [Hillel Levin] So he almost embraced the youth movement, you know, quite literally.
And it's at this point he starts to reinvent himself… physically.
Getting plastic surgery.
The plastic surgery, in particular,
is the jaw, you know, building out his jaws.
[Gail] If you look at him before and after,
he was transformed.
And then he had to, you know, get the right kind of wife,
translation.ko: 그러고 나서는 결혼 상대를 찾으려 했죠

translation.en: who had to be half his age and a model.
[Cristina] He was 25 years older than I was.
I was 24 when I married him.
He was a fitness buff. I never thought of him as an older person.
translation.ko: 존은 운동광이었고 늙었다고 느껴진 적 없었어요

translation.en: Plus, I was fascinated with his mind and his knowledge of things.
translation.ko: 게다가 저는 존의 사고방식과 지식에 매료됐죠

translation.en: He was always ambitious.
I know that he loved the limelight.
He liked being the superstar.
You know, you could tell by the way he dressed, by the way he conducted himself in business.
translation.ko: 옷차림과 일할 때 모습을 보면 알 수 있죠

translation.en: In the back of his mind,
he always wanted to end up having his own car company.
translation.ko: 본인의 자동차 회사를 소유하고 싶단 생각이 있었어요

translation.en: Being part or being one seventh or one tenth of some committee
is a very unappealing thing to me.
The other thing is I'm action-oriented.
I like to be tied-in with the specifics.
translation.ko: 세부 내용까지 직접 개입하는 걸 좋아해요

translation.en: When I was interviewing him, I got that he was a, you know,
translation.ko: 존 드로리안을 인터뷰하면서 느낄 수 있었어요

translation.en: an enormously powerful personality,
and did have fabulous ideas,
and was sure he could amaze the world,
translation.ko: 세상을 놀라게 할 만한 사람이라는 걸요

translation.en: but he couldn't do it at General Motors.
And he wanted to figure out how to get out of that.
-[man] Now, the news at nine o'clock. -[reporter 1] Good evening.
The Middle East war produced developments all over the world today.
translation.ko: 중동 전쟁이 오늘 전 세계에 영향을 미쳤습니다

translation.en: [reporter 2] 11 Arab countries cut off all oil shipments to the United States.
We are heading toward the most acute shortages of energy
translation.ko: 현재 미국은 제2차 세계 대전 이래 최악의 에너지 위기에

translation.en: since World War Two.
[Ralph Nader] The oil crisis increased the price of gasoline,
translation.ko: 석유 위기로 인해 휘발유 가격이 올랐고

translation.en: and after John DeLorean left General Motors in 1973,
everybody knew that he saw a marketing opportunity
for an American-built car that was fuel-efficient.
translation.ko: 마케팅 기회를 봤단 건 모두가 아는 사실이었죠

translation.en: [Hillel] In the '70s, people were suddenly very concerned about fuel efficiency
and the impact of cars on the environment.
translation.ko: 자동차가 환경에 미치는 영향을 신경 쓰기 시작했어요

translation.en: And, you know, that was very much part of the zeitgeist of the time.
So, DeLorean, just like he did with the youth movement in the '60s,
now he's saying his car was going to appeal to people who are concerned about the environment.
translation.ko: 이제는 환경을 생각하는 사람들이 매료될 차를 만든다고 선언했어요

translation.en: [John] We're doing a sports racing car. Very lightweight, excellent fuel economy.
translation.ko: 스포츠 레이싱 카를 구상하고 있어요 차체가 아주 가볍고 연비가 뛰어나죠

translation.en: It's going to be very beautiful aesthetically,
and it's going to be designed in materials that have an eternal life.
It's designed to last.
[Ivan] He was going to build this very glamorous car that, for a start, didn't use much petrol.
translation.ko: 연료를 적게 먹는 화려한 차를 만들 예정이었어요

translation.en: It was going to be built out of stainless steel.
He was embracing the zeitgeist at the time,
the environment.
That was the dream he had.
Using all-new materials, new designs, new everything.
translation.ko: 완전히 새로운 자재와 디자인으로 신선한 제품을 내는 것

translation.en: It was going to be all the things he had learned
from his lifetime in the motor industry.
translation.ko: 평생 배운 것들의 집약체를 만들려고 했죠

translation.en: And it was a fairly easy dream to sell.
John was a guy that had exciting ideas,

translation.ko: 새 프로젝트를 진행하는 건 언제나 즐겁죠

translation.en: He said, "Well, I want to do a two-passenger sports car,

translation.ko: 저더러 수석 엔지니어가 되어 달라고 하더군요

"I can understand it."
"But I know our life is probably going to radically change in one way or another."
translation.ko: '하지만 우리 인생이 어떻게든 급격히 변화할 거야'

translation.en: And I was right.
Bill, to his credit, was the person that built the first prototypes.
translation.ko: 빌이 대단하게도 첫 번째 시제품을 만들었어요 "닉 서턴 - DMC 부품 팀장"

translation.en: How he did that on a shoestring, I just wouldn't know.
The first prototype was magnificent,
and John used that to sell the brand.
[Chris] We met John at the Car Dealers Convention
in New Orleans.
I mean, I don't think John DeLorean had any clue who we were.
translation.ko: 존 드로리안은 우리가 누군지 전혀 몰랐겠죠

translation.en: I don't think he, you know,
watched Don't Look Back,
or had any idea about documentary films,
translation.ko: 다큐멘터리 영화에 대해 아는 게 없었을걸요

translation.en: but he liked being on camera.
-How's everything with you? -Everything's good.
My little daughter drives me crazy. I've never had so much fun in my life.
translation.ko: 딸아이 덕분에 제 평생 최고로 행복해요

translation.en: I have a two-year-old girl,
and it's absolutely the greatest thing that's ever happened to me.
[man] That's great.
I take her out to dinner once in a while, just the two of us, and…
translation.ko: 가끔은 둘이서만 저녁 먹으러 외출도 해요

translation.en: -[man] Okay. -Yeah. It's really fun.
John was there to charm dealers
and get them to invest $25,000 in stock in his company
because this was part of the financing plan for the car.
How much does this cost in pounds?
-We haven't set a price on it yet. -You haven't?
[Chris] A lot of the dealers had already invested in the company,
translation.ko: 많은 딜러들은 이미 회사에 투자한 상태였고

translation.en: and they were so excited to see John,
and John was like a rock star, basically, there,
and he had Cristina, you know, his wife, this beautiful model, on his arm.
translation.ko: 곁에는 아름다운 모델 아내 크리스티나가 함께했고요

translation.en: -Mac Magruder, from Palm Springs. -How are you?
-How you doing? -[John] Good to see you.
You know, I, uh, I got 44 orders.
-[John] That's incredible. -Yeah. [laughs]

translation.ko: - 굉장하군요 - 그렇죠 뵐 때마다 젊어지시네요 비결이 뭐죠?

translation.en: -No. We're gonna do that. -[woman] How'd you beat us here? Hi, John.
translation.ko: - 아니에요 - 어떻게 먼저 왔어? 안녕하세요, 존

translation.en: -[John] How are you? -Fine.
45 orders. Doris wants one.
translation.ko: 총 45대네요 제 아내 도리스도 갖고 싶대요

translation.en: -That's my wife. -[John] She gets the last one, right?
translation.ko: 총 45대네요 제 아내 도리스도 갖고 싶대요 부인이 맨 마지막에 받으시는 거죠?

translation.en: [Matt] The last one, yeah. Not the first one, the last one.
translation.ko: 그렇죠, 첫 차가 아니라 마지막 차를 받을 거예요

translation.en: [Chris] People wanted him to succeed
because they would be pulled along on this, you know, amazing ride
translation.ko: 존의 등에 매달려 함께 가길 원했으니까요

translation.en: that he was going on.
[Ivan] DeLorean was going to put his own name on the motor company and on the car,
translation.ko: 드로리안은 회사와 자동차에 본인 이름을 붙였어요

translation.en: and that's a huge marketing advantage for a start.
translation.ko: 일단 마케팅 측면에서 큰 이점이 되죠

translation.en: And he then talked about, "I want to build a company which,
translation.ko: 언젠가 포드나 제너럴 모터스처럼 크게 성장할 회사를 만들고 싶다고 얘기했어요

translation.en: one day, will be as big as Ford and General Motors."
translation.ko: 크게 성장할 회사를 만들고 싶다고 얘기했어요

translation.en: That's the way he talked, very ambitious,
uh, very-- but very innovative man.
[Cristina] He was always ambitious,
but he was driven to, I think by demons from his childhood,
translation.ko: 어린 시절 힘들었던 기억의 망령에 이끌려서 그랬는지

translation.en: to want to be extremely successful.
He came from a very abusive background because his father was a major alcoholic.
translation.ko: 심각한 알코올 중독자였던 아버지 밑에서 학대를 당하며 자랐거든요

translation.en: I think my dad… loved his father,
but I think it was a complicated relationship.
[Zach] My dad was born in 1925.
His parents, I mean, I think, you know, went through Ellis Island.
translation.ko: 제 조부모님은 엘리스섬을 거쳐 오셨을 거예요

translation.en: I mean, they were immigrants.
Where his parents and his family came from was Romania,

translation.ko: 당시 디트로이트에는 큰 루마니아인 공동체가 있었죠

translation.en: you know, and where he lived.
[P.J.] Um, it's interesting.
They didn't go to New York, as previous generations of immigrants had.
translation.ko: 이전 세대 이민자들처럼 뉴욕으로 가지 않았고

translation.en: They went to the "Boomtown."
They went to the Silicon Valley of its day,

translation.ko: 자동차 회사가 이민자들에게 일자리를 많이 제공했어요

translation.en: [John] You know, my father, he was the youngest of 13 kids

translation.ko: 제 아버지는 13형제 중 막내셨어요 중앙 유럽의 한 농가에서 태어나셨죠

translation.en: He came to this country all by himself at age 15 or 16,
and then he fought his way through a variety of jobs
including, you know, being a cowboy,
you know, a foundry worker at the Ford Motor company,
which is really where he spent most of his life.
[J. Patrick Wright] His father had a hard time with the language.
He worked at Ford Motor Company, he was a tradesman.
It was the life of a working person's family.
translation.ko: 전형적인 노동자 가족의 삶을 산 겁니다

translation.en: His father and mother, apparently, they had a hard time getting along.
Things got rough and she'd pick up the kids

and that was kind of his life.
[Zach] We would sometimes talk about his family or his…
translation.ko: 가끔 아버지의 가정사나 어린 시절 얘기를 나눴어요

translation.en: The way he grew up.
He had talked about how, like,
uh, his dad and his buddies, you know, on payday on a Friday night,
would go get their paycheck, go to a local bar, and,
you know, get into fights,
beat the crap out of the cops when they came or be--
And these big brawls would spill out on the street,
translation.ko: 큰 싸움이 술집 밖 거리까지 이어지기도 했죠

translation.en: and my dad had said that his father kind of enjoyed that.
I think his-- He said his dad was an alcoholic.
There was some physical abuse going on in the household.
[John] The way the world cast its lot,
you know, my father, he was destined to be a common laborer,
translation.ko: 제 아버지는 평범한 노동자로 살아갈 운명이었죠

translation.en: you know, all of his life.
He also led a frustrated life
because he felt he had a contribution to make.
Nobody would listen when you're just the little guy
translation.ko: 콘크리트 바닥에 있는 일개 시민의 말은 아무도 듣지 않잖아요

translation.en: down on the foundry floor.
translation.ko: 일개 시민의 말은 아무도 듣지 않잖아요

translation.en: [Gail] And I got him talking about, "Where did he come from?"
"What was his family life like?"
And he got very, you know, despondent
and told me that his father was a factory worker.
He was a drunk.
He died and left the family with nothing,
translation.ko: 돌아가시면서 가족에게 남긴 것 하나 없었대요

translation.en: and John with no emotional sense of love, or belonging,
or self-worth.
You could tell from the way he told it in a halting way
translation.ko: 머뭇거리며 얘기하는 걸 보고 알 수 있었어요

translation.en: that there was a lot of pain there.
There was a lot of loss.
There was a lot of sense of never being anything or anybody,
just a kind of throwaway ghetto kid.
And that certainly never went with the image
that the public had once he began rolling.
So, you knew that underneath
he would probably always have a sense of inner powerlessness
and fear of being nobody,
translation.ko: 존재감을 잃는 것에 대한 두려움과 무력감이 내재돼 있었을 거예요

translation.en: so he had to become really somebody
to, um… keep that at bay.
translation.ko: 존은 유명해지기 위해 발버둥 쳐야 했던 거죠

translation.en: What he could imagine himself being like his heroes.
translation.ko: 본인이 영웅으로 삼던 이들처럼 되고 싶어 했어요

translation.en: The originals who started this greatest company in the world,
who were, you know, independent-minded pioneers doing it from the ground up.
translation.ko: 무에서 유를 창조해 낸 자주적인 선구자가

translation.en: Those were his heroes. That's what he wanted to be like.
[John] I think that the people that built the automobile business,
they were a rough, tough, driven bunch of bastards.
I mean, you hear stories about those guys, you can't believe it.
translation.ko: 그 사람들 이야기는 듣고도 못 믿으실걸요

translation.en: They used to work unbelievable hours.
translation.ko: 일하는 시간도 말도 안 되게 길었고요

translation.en: Absolutely they were an incredible and unusual bunch of people.
Just, really, the pioneers, the developers, the builders.
translation.ko: 선구자, 개발자이자 제작자라고 할 수 있어요

translation.en: We still gotta work on that front end, though, and get back to that brush--
Hello, there.
-Isn't it just a gorgeous thing? -She heard the first thing you said.
translation.ko: 정말 근사하지 않나요? 아까 한 말 다 들으셨어요

translation.en: They know they have to do something with that, I'm sure.
[Ivan] John DeLorean needed the seed money to build this car.
translation.ko: 존 드로리안에겐 차를 만들 자본금이 필요했어요

translation.en: So if you go around the dealers around America, which he did,
translation.ko: 그래서 미국 전역에서 온 딜러들 사이를 돌아다니며

translation.en: and say, "Look, you know, I'm gonna produce this car."
"Would you guarantee, in advance, to take 20 cars, 30 cars, 50 cars?"
You know, they matched the fender line with the window lines,
put louvers in the back,
changed the wheels,
and it's still as gorgeous as it ever was. Or better.
translation.ko: 그래도 예전 그대로 아름답죠 더 나을지도요

translation.en: And he got 350 dealers,
and he said guaranteed orders for 30,000 cars.
But they weren't firm orders.
But he still, obviously, hadn't got enough money to build the factory,
translation.ko: 그런데 멋진 신차 제작을 위한 공장과 제반 시설을 짓기엔

translation.en: to build everything that was needed to produce this wonderful new car.
translation.ko: 그런데 멋진 신차 제작을 위한 공장과 제반 시설을 짓기엔 아직도 자금이 모자랐어요

translation.en: [Walter Strycker] John didn't have anywhere near any money to build anything.
translation.ko: 존에겐 뭐 하나 만들 만큼의 돈도 없었어요

translation.en: What we needed, really, was a couple 100 million dollars
to, you know, finally be able to build the plant,
build the car, and to have working capital.
And that's what we were looking for in these different sites.
translation.ko: 우린 부족한 만큼을 보충하기 위해 여러 지역을 돌아다녔어요

translation.en: He shopped around to look for the best deal he could get.
translation.ko: 존은 가장 좋은 조건을 따내려고 부지런히 알아봤습니다

translation.en: The ideal… situation for him
was if he could get money and build a car, and not have to put any dough in.
translation.ko: 본인 사비는 안 들이면서 돈을 투자받아 차를 만드는 거였죠

translation.en: He was close to a deal to take his factory to Texas.
He also shopped the city of Detroit.
He shopped Allentown, Pennsylvania.
He even went up to Maine.
[Ivan] He originally thought of building it in Detroit or somewhere in America,
translation.ko: 원래는 디트로이트나 미국 어딘가에 지으려고 했는데

translation.en: but then he found that if you went overseas, uh, Puerto Rico, or somewhere of that kind,
they would offer you huge grants, they'd build a factory for you,
translation.ko: 그 국가에서 큰 보조금을 주고 공장도 지어준단 걸 알게 됐죠

translation.en: and that became quite attractive to him.
And that's when he first went to Puerto Rico,
got into negotiations there.
They all went sour.
[Bill Collins] We went round and round. We spent lots of time in Italy.
translation.ko: 우린 돌고 돌았어요 이탈리아에서 많은 시간을 보냈고

translation.en: We were going to take over Maserati.
And I got sent to some place in Spain
where the GM plant was closing.
We just kept running around, looking for some way to get a free plant.
translation.ko: 공장을 공짜로 얻기 위해 계속해서 돌아다녔어요

translation.en: [Ivan] And then the Republic of Ireland became involved.
The IDA, the Industrial Development Authority of Ireland,
was very, very active in trying to bring in investors into Ireland.
translation.ko: 투자자를 아일랜드에 끌어들이려 혈안이 된 상태였어요

translation.en: [man] The Industrial Development Authority, the IDA,
came to me and they said some of their people in America
translation.ko: 산업 개발청이 제게 와서는 미국에 있는 직원 몇 명이

translation.en: were talking to a man called DeLorean
who had a project for a revolutionary new type of car.
translation.ko: "데즈 오맬리 아일랜드 정치인, 1977-81" 획기적인 신차를 만들 계획이라고 하더군요

translation.en: [Ivan] Des O'Malley, he was the minister in charge.
translation.ko: 당시 관련 부처의 장관이었던 데즈 오맬리는

translation.en: He was hugely-- he'd keep pressing for it very hard.
But one of the IDA officials said,
"Hang on a second."
"I don't think we've looked at all of this, have we?"
"Do we know that these firm orders for 30,000 cars actually exist?"
translation.ko: '3만 대의 선주문이 실제로 존재하는 게 확실한가요?'

translation.en: "Have we tested this?"
So this guy went over and knocked on the doors of these dealers.
translation.ko: 그러고는 자동차 딜러들을 직접 찾아가 확인했고

translation.en: He came back and said, "Look, I'm sorry. These orders don't exist."
And the Irish were forced to pull the offer at the very last moment.
translation.ko: 아일랜드는 체결 직전에 제안을 철회할 수밖에 없었죠

translation.en: [man] It was a question, really, of the risk involved, as we saw it,
and we thought that it really didn't fit the kind of criteria
which we apply in these things
and therefore we decided to withdraw from the negotiation.
[Walter] Arthur Andersen was our accounting firm,
translation.ko: 우리 회사를 담당하는 회계 법인 '아서 앤더슨'이 말하길

translation.en: and they said, well, they had a special group
for Industrial Development in North Ireland,
and that they had a different attitude.
And so I told John,
"John, I'm going up to Belfast to meet with the people in North Ireland."
translation.ko: 북아일랜드의 벨파스트에 가서 그 사람들을 만나겠다고 했죠

translation.en: [man] The British government were desperate for investments.
John DeLorean was desperate for money.
So, they didn't ask too many questions
translation.ko: 그래서 그쪽에서는 드로리안이 장담한 판매량에 관해

translation.en: about the sales that DeLorean promised.
Why, the British government and North Ireland would fund you forever.
translation.ko: 영국 정부와 북아일랜드가 왜 자금을 지원하겠어요?

translation.en: 'Cause it was, you know, 2,500 employees.
We worked out a contract, and the financing,
and how it would work, and all that.
And we got that all done,
and then I called John and I said, "John, we got it funded."
And it was dead silence. [chuckling]
That was the thing that I thought, "Oh, sh…"
And then John was going, "Oh, Christ. Are we gonna do this?"
[reporter] The British government is committed to John DeLorean
and his company to the tune of £84 million.
translation.ko: 영국 정부는 무려 8천 4백만 파운드라는 거금을 드로리안과 그의 회사에 투자합니다

translation.en: They accomplished so much so quickly.
All the little obstacles that we've had other places
translation.ko: 다른 곳에선 우리 발목을 잡았던 모든 장애물이

translation.en: were just taken care of immediately.
[man] This is a car assembly plant.
It's a specialized product.
translation.ko: 특화 상품이죠 "로이 메이슨 북아일랜드 국무 장관"

translation.en: It's the United States market it's going for.
translation.ko: "로이 메이슨 북아일랜드 국무 장관" 미국 시장으로 수출될 겁니다

translation.en: The company have got 400 outlets already.
They've got private investment behind them.
They've got 30,000 orders already for the car.
On June 22nd, the Belfast Telegraph broke the story
that there was to be a massive new factory in West Belfast.
translation.ko: 서부 벨파스트에 거대한 공장이 건설된다고 보도했습니다

translation.en: It's here, on this green field site that the biggest industrial gamble
translation.ko: 이곳 미개발지에서 이 지역 사상 최대의

translation.en: this province has ever seen is to take place.
Within two years,
a factory costing £60 million worth of taxpayers' money is to be built.
translation.ko: 국민의 세금을 6천만 파운드 사용해 2년 내로 공장을 지을 예정입니다

translation.en: This is an area of extremely high unemployment.
One man in three is without work.
There's complete euphoria about this factory.
In nearly every household, there's an application form.
translation.ko: 거의 모든 가정에 입사 지원서가 있죠

translation.en: [Jeremy Paxman] Today, in the unlikely setting of West Belfast,
John Delorean's dream is becoming reality.
translation.ko: 존 드로리안의 꿈이 현실이 되고 있습니다

translation.en: I want to tell you what a great pleasure it is for all of us to be here.
translation.ko: 이 자리에 있게 되어 얼마나 기쁜지 모릅니다

translation.en: It's actually the culmination of a lot of years of very, very hard work.
translation.ko: 수년간의 노력의 결실이라고 할 수 있죠

translation.en: [Jeremy] The chariot of Delorean's dreams is wide-bodied and low-slung.
translation.ko: 드로리안의 자동차는 폭이 넓으며 차체가 낮습니다

translation.en: So far, only two working models have been built.
translation.ko: 현재까지 제작된 작동하는 시제품은 두 대뿐입니다

translation.en: [Jeremy] It is, in the view of many,
the sexiest thing on four wheels.
translation.ko: 네 바퀴 달린 것 중 가장 섹시하다고요

translation.en: [Jeremy] I thought it was really bizarre
that someone who looked and acted as DeLorean did,
and came from this other world.
I mean, he just came in with this perma-tan and perfect teeth
translation.ko: 선탠한 피부와 완벽한 치아를 가진 이가 "제러미 팩스먼 BBC 북아일랜드 특파원"

translation.en: into this grotty part of the country,
translation.ko: "제러미 팩스먼 BBC 북아일랜드 특파원" 비루한 동네에 난데없이 나타난 거예요

translation.en: where he was going to build this factory to build this dream car.
translation.ko: 거기에 공장을 짓고 꿈의 차를 생산한다면서요

translation.en: I thought it was extraordinary.
[reporter] The center of Belfast again, a massive bomb explodes.
translation.ko: 벨파스트의 중심에 또 거대한 폭발이 일어납니다

translation.en: Well, DeLorean was so, um,
dazzled by his own idea,
he just brushed it off and,
"Oh, this is-- There's nothing going on in Northern Ireland
that could compete with Detroit."
"I mean, more people get killed in Detroit than happens in Northern Ireland."
Which was totally the opposite of the truth.
[John] I had an interesting conversation
when this young man who did the story in the Detroit Free Press Parade section,
translation.ko: 디트로이트 신문사의 퍼레이드 부문 기사를 쓴 기자가

translation.en: uh, called me up.
I said, "I'll make you a interesting arrangement."
translation.ko: 제가 재미있는 제안을 하나 하겠다고 했죠

translation.en: I said, "Tonight at midnight,
I'll go out and I'll take a one-hour walk around downtown Belfast
translation.ko: '저는 벨파스트 시내를 한 시간 동안 걷고'

translation.en: and you go take a one-hour walk around downtown Detroit."
translation.ko: '당신은 디트로이트 시내를 한 시간 걷는 거예요'

translation.en: He said, "What? Are you nuts?"
It was a nasty war,
and every day you went out on a bombing or a shooting.
Two Catholic postmen were gunned down at this same road junction.
translation.ko: 가톨릭 우체부 2명이 이 교차로에서 총격을 당했습니다

translation.en: Last week, two workmen were gunned down at the junction next down the road.
translation.ko: 지난주에는 노동자 2명이 이다음 교차로에서 총을 맞았죠

translation.en: [Jeremy] And DeLorean was walking into this,
this guy with this "hail-fellow-well-met" attitude.
He could be quite charming.
But he was walking into an absolute snake pit.
